messages: fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:05): can anyone have a look at this code? http://sial.org/pbot/19955

fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:09): what should I amend to fix the banner margins?
4b1bee0e40377c8094df2adb4ae9c6e5 (00:09): i can't help you if i can't see the complete code

132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (00:10): verhhy open the apge in a browser, hit View -> Source and try to guess what's wrong

fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:12): StaZ[work] I am looking at it locally, with just the html, browser is not showing any errors, I am suspecting "?> width="730"" is where the problem lies, I am at a loss as to what to change it to
4b1bee0e40377c8094df2adb4ae9c6e5 (00:13): WHAT IS THE URL TO THE PAGE?

5a84943ea563cd5b1bb841f9a8930706 (00:16): whats the full output of that script?
fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:17): Moskito the html when looked at locally only just shows: width="730" height="40" usemap="#Map" border="0">
fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:17): Moskito you mean the full html?
4b1bee0e40377c8094df2adb4ae9c6e5 (00:17): view source of the page and the put it in a pastebin
fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:18): thats from viewsource, that is what it says in viewsource
fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:18): everything from <? to ?> and width="730" height="40" usemap="#Map" border="0">
4b1bee0e40377c8094df2adb4ae9c6e5 (00:18): they you don't have php installed
5a84943ea563cd5b1bb841f9a8930706 (00:18): well, then what about installing php or enabling it in .html files...

fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:20): I dont have access to the server right now, suppose php is installed, and I simply wanted to wrap the php script in a height width border margin, what should I have done?
fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:20): the script is an advert, which I am trying to match to a specific height, width and border
4b1bee0e40377c8094df2adb4ae9c6e5 (00:21): well without know what the script says we can't help you
4b1bee0e40377c8094df2adb4ae9c6e5 (00:22): and without running the page on a php server it won't work anyway

fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:23): Just as you can have <A HREF="http://www.example.com/site1.html"><IMG SRC="http://example.com/sample.gif" BORDER="0" Height="100" Width="50"></A> how do I amend it for <?include ("rot1.php"); ?> if the img scr was replaced with this php script?
5a84943ea563cd5b1bb841f9a8930706 (00:25): you mean img src?
fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:25): yes IMG SCR
5a84943ea563cd5b1bb841f9a8930706 (00:26): anyway, don't you think you would like to learn php before using it?
fb79bd4b7e62ff86966b7fa0682027fa (00:26): instead of IMG SCR the image source is replaced with the php script
5a84943ea563cd5b1bb841f9a8930706 (00:26): (and I mean just the basics)
4b1bee0e40377c8094df2adb4ae9c6e5 (00:26): haha
5a84943ea563cd5b1bb841f9a8930706 (00:27): I still don't get what you want, does your php produce the output of a picture?

5a84943ea563cd5b1bb841f9a8930706 (00:27): <A HREF="http://www.example.com/site1.html"><IMG SRC="rot1.php" BORDER="0" Height="100" Width="50"></A> how do I amend it for <?include ("rot1.php"); ?>
5a84943ea563cd5b1bb841f9a8930706 (00:28): today I must have my good day...

8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:05): so how do i change the look of the number in the <ol>?
8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:05): trying to search
8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:05): but i suck at searching obviously :)
8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:06): I want it just like my <h3>... should I do <h3><li>blah </h3>? That doesnt look right?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (01:07): alter font properties for the li's
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (01:07): `css font @ helvete
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (01:07): helvete, css font: http://w3.org/TR/CSS21/fonts.html#propdef-font
8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:08): i don't want to change the font for the content of the li... like <li>blablabla</li>
8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:09): Just the number that the <li> gives
8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:09): <h3><li>blah blah</h3> here's the text </li> gives the right result, but it doesnt look like correct code
8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:10): things cant go arround like that..
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (01:10): you can use <li><span>contents</span></li> to use li span { to override what you apply via li {
8ec2f7530641ab35b68592a50e81fafb (01:11): that's the only way? :(
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (01:12): likely it is not
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (01:13): seems like the simplest way to me at this moment in time, however
